page.title: 05EDUCATION IN THE VILLAGE
page.content: 1.DR. CHALLONER'S HIGH SCHOOL,one of the few remaining grammar schools in the country,split from Dr Challoner's Grammar School in September 1963. Originally built for 3-form entry of girls at 11, it now has 5-form entry at 12. Places are obtained through the 12+ examination, consisting of 3 verbal reasoning tests. 2.LITTLE CHALFONT LIBRARY, built in 1975, employs five staff and houses 11,500 books, newspapers and periodicals. It is used by an average of 1,000 people per week. Playschemes and storytimes are run for children twice a week. 3.AMERSHAM COLLEGE has 4 main depts.: Art & Design, Business Studies, Humanities and Technical and Scientific Studies. Courses are for full- or part-time students including adults.
